column4: anyone know how i can get a list of what shortcuts are on my gnome panel?
gconf-editor i think. actual items are individual entries in there somewhere iirc.
erm, now how do i delete items? won't let me
dunno, sry. im a qt/kde guy. the right click menu once upon a time had a delete item.. :?
except there is no context menu
googleing suggests gconftool-2, but that's tedious
question, where are the xscreensavers? the config UI lists them all.. but says they are uninstalled.
no idea. why can't you edit the panels manually?
sounds like a bug or fail..
'cause that's the problem... the icon for at least one shortcut has disappeared
this isn't the first time either, so i'm looking to do some cleanup
maybe the icon is unavailable at panel creation time? it's located on a seperate partition/device? then gnome automounts it after drawing the panel items? just a guess..
if the normal context menus aren't working, sth else..
i suspect it's thumbnails getting cleaned up or something...
